caption.p: Hepadnavirus diversity and geographic distribution. (A) Maximum-likelihood phylogenetic tree of known hepadnaviruses. Symbols are indicative of viral hosts. The tree of representative hepadnavirus polymerase/reverse-transcriptase (RT) domain was obtained using PhyML [136]. The insert shows the phylogenetic relationship of HBV extant genotypes, HBV ancient strains (in gray), and NHP viruses. (B) Present-day worldwide distribution of the most prevalent HBV genotypes. Geographic distributions derive from Refs. [35], [36], [37], [38], [39], [137].
